schedule.title: Daily commands!
schedule.description:
Date and hour are optional arguments that can specify when the the bot should send the comic. 
There are 2 ways to set up scheduled comics:
Latest: Get only the latest comics when they are posted, no need to set up an exact day of the week or an hour of the day.
Regular: Get the comic at a regular day and hour of the week. A date should be one of the seven days of the week and the hour a number representing the time in a 24h clock in UTC time (0h to 23h). If not specified, defaults to the current time in UTC.

fields.name: Post
fields.value: The bot did not post the comics or you want to be sure that all comics are correctly set up? Use `/post <date> <hour>` to force the post of comics set at the specified time.

fields.name: Add
fields.value: Use `/<name_of_comic> add <date> <hour>` to add the comic to the daily list of the channel.

fields.name: Add all
fields.value: Use `/add_all <date> <hour>` to add all the comics to a specific day of the week and hour.

fields.name: Remove
fields.value: Use `/<name_of_comic> remove <date> <hour>` to remove the comic from the daily list.

fields.name: Remove channel
fields.value: Use `/remove_channel` to unsubscribe your channel from all the comics

fields.name: Remove all
fields.value: Use `/remove_all` to unsubscribe your server from all the comics in all the channels.

fields.name: Subscriptions
fields.value: Use `/sub` to view all subscribed comics for this server.

fields.name: Set role mention
fields.value: Use `/set_role @<role>` to add a role to mention for comics posts. To remove, use `/remove_role`.

fields.name: Get mention policy
fields.value: Use `/get_mention` to get the server's mention policy.

new.title: New features
new.description: Find out what new features have been implemented since the last update!

fields.name: Comics
fields.value: Some comics have has been removed because they are finished or are not posting anymore, Garfield minus Garfield and Webtoons now work.

fields.name: Changes in /random add <schedule>
fields.value: Now, adding a random to a schedule will not add a fixed comic to be set to the schedule but the comic will be different each time on that schedule!

fields.name: Optimizations
fields.value: Under the hood, optimizations have been made to the bot to make it more responsive and support the growth! I am also looking into porting the bot to other platforms like Matrix and Revolt.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: Have a question on the bot? This is the place you are looking for!

fields.name: What is this bot?
fields.value: This bot is a helper to keep up with your favorite comics! It search each hour more than 40+ pages to fetch the most up to date comics for your eyes only!

fields.name: Why can I only go up to 14 comics in the past for Gocomics comics?
fields.value: As of April 1st 2025, Gocomics implemented a premium membership to view older comics. You can go on their site to get one and see the comics directly in your browser.

fields.name: How can I support the project?
fields.value: You can vote for the bot on top.gg (`/vote`) or star the project on GitHub (`/git`). If you want to support one of the comics that are presented through this bot, go on  their page to see how to support them directly!

fields.name: How can I request comics?
fields.value: You can use `/request` to request comics or features directly to the developer.

fields.name: How can I receive scheduled comics?
fields.value: You can use `/help schedule` to get help on how to schedule comics.

fields.name: What information is collected by using this bot?
fields.value: No personal information is used by this bot if you only use it to read comics. The information collected by the bot when a comic is scheduled is: the ID of the server, the ID of the channel, the ID of the role to mention, the server's mention policy and the information about the scheduled comic itself. This information is deleted when the bot loses access to the server or when all comics of the server have been unscheduled. When you use `/request`, your username, your discriminator, the time of the message and the message itself is logged to prevent abuse and relevance of the request. To delete this personal information (and get rid of the requests sent), use `/delete_request`.
